pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:0.5: 60. The training rule on holding a weapon
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a weapon. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.3: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.6: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.7: If a monk out of disrespect gives a teaching to someone holding a weapon who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.11: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.12: The sixth chapter on slurping is finished.
